briefdescription.para: market trades in this asset may be charged

simplesect.para: If one of these bits is set in asset issuer permissions, it means the asset issuer (or owner for bitassets) has the permission to update the corresponding flag, parameters or perform certain actions.

briefdescription.para: accounts must be whitelisted in order to hold or transact this asset
issuer may transfer asset back to himself
require the issuer to be one party to every transfer
allow the bitasset owner to force a global settling, permission only
disallow the asset to be used with confidential transactions
the bitasset is to be fed by witnesses

detaileddescription.para: the bitasset is to be fed by the committee

briefdescription.para: the max supply of the asset can not be updated

simplesect.para: If one of these bits is set in asset issuer permissions, it means the asset issuer (or owner for bitassets) does NOT have the permission to update the corresponding flag, parameters or perform certain actions. This is to be compatible with old client software.

detaileddescription.para: unable to create new supply for the asset

briefdescription.para: the bitasset owner can not update MCR, permisison only

simplesect.para: These parameters are for issuer permission only. For each parameter, if it is set in issuer permission, it means the bitasset owner can not update the corresponding parameter. In this case, if the value of the parameter was set by the bitasset owner, it can not be updated; if no value was set by the owner, the value can still be updated by the feed producers.

briefdescription.para: the bitasset owner can not update ICR, permisison only

detaileddescription.para: the bitasset owner can not update MSSR, permisison only

detaileddescription.para: For future expansion many structus include a single member of type extensions_type that can be changed when updating a protocol. You can always add new types to a static_variant without breaking backward compatibility.
A flat_set is used to make sure that only one extension of each type is added and that they are added in order.

simplesect.para: static_variant compares only the type tag and not the content.

detaileddescription.para: Names must comply with the following grammar (RFC 1035): <domain>::=<subdomain>|"" <subdomain>::=<label>|<subdomain>"."<label> <label>::=<letter>[[<ldh-str>]<let-dig>] <ldh-str>::=<let-dig-hyp>|<let-dig-hyp><ldh-str> <let-dig-hyp>::=<let-dig>|"-" <let-dig>::=<letter>|<digit>
Which is equivalent to the following:
I.e. a valid name consists of a dot-separated sequence of one or more labels consisting of the following rules:

listitem.para: Each label is three characters or more
Each label begins with a letter
Each label ends with a letter or digit
Each label contains only letters, digits or hyphens

detaileddescription.para: In addition we require the following:

listitem.para: Length is between (inclusive) GRAPHENE_MIN_ACCOUNT_NAME_LENGTH and GRAPHENE_MAX_ACCOUNT_NAME_LENGTH

detaileddescription.para: Valid symbols can contain [A-Z0-9], and '.' They must start with [A, Z] They must end with [A, Z] before HF_620 or [A-Z0-9] after it They can contain a maximum of one '.'
Add all account members of the given authority to the given flat_set.

briefdescription.para: get_restriction_predicate Get a predicate function for the supplied restriction

parameterdescription.para: The restrictions to evaluate operations against
The tag specifying which operation type the restrictions apply to

simplesect.para: A predicate function which evaluates an operation to determine whether it complies with the restriction

briefdescription.para: Create a predicate asserting on the field of the object a restriction is referencing.

detaileddescription.para:
Object
The type the restriction restricts
A restriction specifies requirements about a field of an object. This struct shifts the focus from the object type the restriction references to the particular field type, creates a predicate on that field, and wraps that predicate to accept the object type and invoke the inner predicate on the specified field.

detaileddescription.para: Appends required authorites to the result vector. The authorities appended are not the same as those returned by get_required_auth

simplesect.para: a set of required authorities for op

memberdef.name: verify_authority

detaileddescription.para: Checks whether given public keys and approvals are sufficient to authorize given operations. Throws an exception when failed.

parameterdescription.para: callback function to retrieve active authorities of a given account
callback function to retrieve owner authorities of a given account
callback function to retrieve viable custom authorities for a given account and operation
whether to allow owner authority of non-immediately required accounts to authorize operations
See issue #210; whether to ignore the required_auths field of custom_operation or not
maximum level of recursion when verifying, since an account can have another account in active authorities and/or owner authorities
whether to allow the special "committee account" to authorize the operations
accounts that approved the operations with their active authories
accounts that approved the operations with their owner authories
